# 💎 Carat, Karat, Carrot 🥕

All three are very important words that mean very different things.

> **Carat** is used to measure the weight of stones.  1 carat is equal to 200 miligrams.  So, the first stone in my list up above, weighing 0.23 carat, weighs 46mg.

> **Karat** is used to measure the purity of gold. Gold can be mixed with other metals, making it less pure. The purest gold is 24 karat, and most 24k jewelry will have this stamped into the design somewhere.

> A **carrot** is used to provide energy to humans and animals. They're chock full of carotenoids, which are broken down into key vitamins in the body. They're also quite tasty!
